channel.title: Omg need help bad!
channel.description: How do i make it so if some1 does the command ::disable (name) then it kicks the person and when they log back in if they try to do anything it says you have been disabled. or make ti so if some1 does the disable command when they try to do something it says type ::dmenu.

item.title: Omg need help bad!
item.dc:creator: @iatchi1019 iatchi1019
item.description:
@iatchi1019 wrote:

they are all lowercase. but i got the disable command working. but when u log out and back in you can move again and disable is set back to 0

Read full topic

@Waffles1 wrote:

After adding all 3 things for disable, make sure that they are ALL lowercase letters - disable.
Then it should work fine.

item.title: Omg need help bad!
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

} else if (token.equals("character-kitstarter")) { kitstarter = Integer.parseInt(token2);

Around that mofo I got:

[code]if (token.equals(“character-clueid”)) {
clueid = Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals(“character-cluelevel”)) {
cluelevel = Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals(“character-cluestage”)) {
cluestage = Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals(“character-lastlogin”)) {
playerLastConnect = (token2);
} else if (token.equals(“character-lastlogintime”)) {
lastlogintime = Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals(“character-kitstarter”)) {
kitstarter = Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals(“character-reputation”)) {
reputation = Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals(“character-ancients”)) {
ancients = Integer.parseInt(token2);
} else if (token.equals(“character-hasegg”)) {
hasegg = Integer.parseInt(token2);

					} else if (token.equals("character-logcount")) {
					logcount = Integer.parseInt(token2);
					} else if (token.equals("character-hasset")) {
					    hasset = Integer.parseInt(token2);[/code]

You would add:

} else if (token.equals("character-disable")) { disable = Integer.parseInt(token2);

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

iatchi1019:

im not advertising noob. im asking how to do a dang command. i really need this cause a lot off ppl r gettin banned for massing then compaining they cant find site.

I’m afraid you did advertise.

All websites posted ANYWHERE on the site for ANY reason must be approved, and personal advertising can only be done in signatures on moparisthebest.com.

EDIT: Sorry, I just understood why you did it. I see it was a genuine mistake, it being part of the error message you wanted shown. Still, it was not allowed and has been edited out.

Read full topic

item.title: Omg need help bad!
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

For the time being, to remove the error, don’t worry about the teleblock. Just take that out. Notice I said something LIKE what I posted. Yours might be starter. Easteregg, or something similar, is a common one. You need an int for disable, the parseInt, and the token itself.

^[br][size=1]Posted on: October 03, 2007, 06:31:21 PM[/size][hr]i fixed the errors but i doesnt put disable to the character file[br][size=1]Posted on: October 03, 2007, 06:42:48 PM[/size][hr]i got it working. but now it wont make the disable 1. this is my command

[code] if (command.startsWith(“disable”) && playerRights >= 2)
{
String victim = command.substring(8);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully disabled”);
disable = 1;
System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" is disabling "+victim);
appendToDisable(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/disablelogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" disabled "+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging disabled!");
 }
  }

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./logs/disablelogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" disabled"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging disabled!");
 }
  }

}
if (disable >= 1) {
EntangleDelay = 999999;
teleblock = true;
}[/code]

item.title: Omg need help bad!
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

I told you:
I do not know the boolean/int for teleblocked

Did you add the token for disable?

You find something LIKE

public int kitstarter = 0;

And under it add an int for disable = 0;

Then you find something LIKE

} else if (token.equals(“character-kitstarter”)) {
kitstarter = Integer.parseInt(token2);

Copy it, and paste it under itself, and make it character-disable

Then you find something LIKE

                  characterfile.write("character-kitstarter = ", 0, 23);			
                    characterfile.write(Integer.toString(kitstarter), 0, Integer.toString(kitstarter).length());			
                    characterfile.newLine();

etc

item.title: Omg need help bad!
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Btw - those 3 are in 3 different spots in your client.java. Let me remake the kickuser for you…

if (command.startsWith("disable") && playerRights >= 2) { PlayerHandler.kickNick = command.substring(5); sendMessage("You disabled "+command.substring(5)); disable = 1; System.out.println("Admin:"+playerName+" disabled "+command.substring(5));; } if (disable >= 1) { entangleDelay = 999999; teleblocked = true; }

I’m not sure what it is for being entangled forever, or for being teleblocked…
But that should work.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @iatchi1019 iatchi1019

Read full topic

item.title: Omg need help bad!
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Easy way: Just search ‘starter’ in your client.java. I think there are 3 required things, and you add disable, and it’ll save to moreinfo.

[code]public int kitstarter = 0;

} else if (token.equals(“character-kitstarter”)) {
kitstarter = Integer.parseInt(token2);

                    characterfile.write("character-kitstarter = ", 0, 23);			
                    characterfile.write(Integer.toString(kitstarter), 0, Integer.toString(kitstarter).length());			
                    characterfile.newLine();[/code]

That’s what I found for my starter.

Read full topic

item.title: Omg need help bad!
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Bringing this topic back because I have a solution. Take your kickuser command and remake it for disable. Make the disable command kick you and make the victim’s disable = 1. You’d have to create a token for it, so it saves to the moreinfo file. This way only the owner can change it. Or you can redo the disable command for admins to do enable command, which makes the victim’s disable = 0.

Read full topic
